trans-unit.source: Automating DNS and record sets operations using .net SDK | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Automating DNS and record sets operations using .net SDK | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Using the .NET SDK to automate all DNS operations for Azure DNS.
trans-unit.target: Using the .NET SDK to automate all DNS operations for Azure DNS.

trans-unit.source: Creating DNS zones and record sets using the .NET SDK
trans-unit.target: Creating DNS zones and record sets using the .NET SDK

trans-unit.source: You can automate operations to create , delete or update DNS zones, recordsets and records using DNS SDK with .NET DNS Management library.
trans-unit.target: You can automate operations to create , delete or update DNS zones, recordsets and records using DNS SDK with .NET DNS Management library.

trans-unit.source: A full Visual Studio project is available [here.](http://download.microsoft.com/download/2/A/C/2AC64449-1747-49E9-B875-C71827890126/AzureDnsSDKExample_2015_05_05.zip)
trans-unit.target: A full Visual Studio project is available [here.](http://download.microsoft.com/download/2/A/C/2AC64449-1747-49E9-B875-C71827890126/AzureDnsSDKExample_2015_05_05.zip)

trans-unit.source: NuGet Packages & Namespace Declarations
trans-unit.target: NuGet Packages & Namespace Declarations

trans-unit.source: In order to use the DNS Client, it is necessary to install the “Azure DNS Management Library” NuGet package and add the DNS management namespaces to your project.
trans-unit.target: In order to use the DNS Client, it is necessary to install the “Azure DNS Management Library” NuGet package and add the DNS management namespaces to your project.

trans-unit.source: Go to Visual Studio, open a project or new project and go to tools, Nuget package manager console.
trans-unit.target: Go to Visual Studio, open a project or new project and go to tools, Nuget package manager console.

trans-unit.source: Download the Azure DNS management library:
trans-unit.target: Download the Azure DNS management library:

trans-unit.source: Initializing the DNS Management Client
trans-unit.target: Initializing the DNS Management Client

trans-unit.source: The DnsManagementClient contains the methods and properties necessary for managing DNS zones and recordsets.
trans-unit.target: The DnsManagementClient contains the methods and properties necessary for managing DNS zones and recordsets.

trans-unit.source: In order for the client to be able to access your subscription it is necessary to setup the correct permissions and generate an AWT token, see “Authenticating Azure Resource Manager requests” for more details.
trans-unit.target: In order for the client to be able to access your subscription it is necessary to setup the correct permissions and generate an AWT token, see “Authenticating Azure Resource Manager requests” for more details.

trans-unit.source: Creating or Updating a DNS Zone
trans-unit.target: Creating or Updating a DNS Zone

trans-unit.source: To create a DNS zone, a Zone object is created and passed to dnsClient.Zones.CreateOrUpdate.
trans-unit.target: To create a DNS zone, a Zone object is created and passed to dnsClient.Zones.CreateOrUpdate.

trans-unit.source: As DNS zones are not linked to a specific region, the location is set to "global".
trans-unit.target: As DNS zones are not linked to a specific region, the location is set to "global".

trans-unit.source: create a DNS zone:
trans-unit.target: create a DNS zone:

trans-unit.source: Azure DNS supports optimistic concurrency called [Etags](dns-getstarted-create-dnszone.md#Etags-and-tags) The Etag is a property of the Zone and IfNoneMatch is a property in ZoneCreateOrUpdateParameters.
trans-unit.target: Azure DNS supports optimistic concurrency called [Etags](dns-getstarted-create-dnszone.md#Etags-and-tags) The Etag is a property of the Zone and IfNoneMatch is a property in ZoneCreateOrUpdateParameters.

trans-unit.source: Creating or Updating DNS Records
trans-unit.target: Creating or Updating DNS Records

trans-unit.source: DNS records are managed as a record set.
trans-unit.target: DNS records are managed as a record set.

trans-unit.source: A record set is the set of records with the same name and record type within a zone.
trans-unit.target: A record set is the set of records with the same name and record type within a zone.

trans-unit.source: To create or update a record set, a RecordSet object is created and passed to dnsClient.RecordSets.CreateOrUpdate.
trans-unit.target: To create or update a record set, a RecordSet object is created and passed to dnsClient.RecordSets.CreateOrUpdate.

trans-unit.source: Note that the record set name is relative to the zone name as opposed to being the fully qualified DNS name.
trans-unit.target: Note that the record set name is relative to the zone name as opposed to being the fully qualified DNS name.

trans-unit.source: Again the location is set to "global".
trans-unit.target: Again the location is set to "global".

trans-unit.source: make some records sets
trans-unit.target: make some records sets

trans-unit.source: Azure DNS supports optimistic concurrency [Etags](dns-getstarted-create-dnszone.md#Etags-and-tags).
trans-unit.target: Azure DNS supports optimistic concurrency [Etags](dns-getstarted-create-dnszone.md#Etags-and-tags).

trans-unit.source: The Etag is a property of the RecordSet and IfNoneMatch is a property in RecordSetCreateOrUpdateParameters.
trans-unit.target: The Etag is a property of the RecordSet and IfNoneMatch is a property in RecordSetCreateOrUpdateParameters.

trans-unit.source: Getting Zones and RecordSets
trans-unit.target: Getting Zones and RecordSets

trans-unit.source: The Zones and RecordSets collections provide the ability to get zones and record sets respectively.
trans-unit.target: The Zones and RecordSets collections provide the ability to get zones and record sets respectively.

trans-unit.source: RecordSets are identified by their type, name and the zone (and resource group) they exist in.
trans-unit.target: RecordSets are identified by their type, name and the zone (and resource group) they exist in.

trans-unit.source: Zones are identified by their name and the resource group they exist in.
trans-unit.target: Zones are identified by their name and the resource group they exist in.

trans-unit.source: Listing Zones and RecordSets
trans-unit.target: Listing Zones and RecordSets

trans-unit.source: To list zones, use the List method in the Zones collection.
trans-unit.target: To list zones, use the List method in the Zones collection.

trans-unit.source: To list record sets use the List or ListAll methods in the RecordSets collection.
trans-unit.target: To list record sets use the List or ListAll methods in the RecordSets collection.

trans-unit.source: The List method differs from the ListAll method in that it only returns record sets of the specified type.
trans-unit.target: The List method differs from the ListAll method in that it only returns record sets of the specified type.

trans-unit.source: The following example shows how to get a list of DNS zones and Record sets:
trans-unit.target: The following example shows how to get a list of DNS zones and Record sets:
